TextBody:
Hello Tony,

Thank you for reaching out to Netwrix support regarding your issue. I would be happy to assist you.  I have provided helpful documents below to verify the latest required provisions for the new server as well as the application. 

Requirements

Additionally, we will perform a pre-flight process in preparation for the official migration and 11.6 upgrade. The following will be preformed:

	Screenshots of your global settings as well as custom job query settings. 
	Backups of your jobs folder.
	Backups of any SSL Certificate bindings.

Is the SQL database being migrated as well as any changes to the SQL server host name?

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
Hello Tony,

Thank you for taking the time to meet today.

Today we:
 Performed the pre-flight process in preparation of the official migration/upgrade process. The pre-flight includes the following:

	Screenshots of all global settings and custom job settings. 
	Backups of the Jobs folder. 
	Backups of all listed files and folders below.



Additionally, backups of the database should be restored the day of the upgrade as well as the SQL script that needs to be run to migrate the host data since the SQL hostname is changing. I have attached a helpful document that can assist with migrating this data to this email. 

You will need to download the latest version of the installer from your netwrix.com customer account as well as verify that the installer has been unblocked. I have provided a list of those installers below:

	Netwrix Enterprise Auditor Management Platform
	Sensitive Data Discovery
	Access Information Center


Our next steps are:

You will:

Verify there are no running scheduled jobs.

Perform the backup and restore process when moving the SQL database. 

Run the SQL script to migrate the host data to the new SQL server. 

You will need to download the latest version of the installer from your netwrix.com customer account as well as verify that the installer has been unblocked.

Please use this link to schedule our next meeting at your convenience

https://nwxcorp.my.salesforce-sites.com/cts?Id=8WAMeIebHQ.d8ZXUpexS_QGJNKqFu3qsSPoz1LT.DBo-Z&MeetingID=OMYn334E.KbXAEBIuGvoJK2oMY9u7LJRnJSlCFr6nEc-Z

If you have any questions please let me know.

​​​​​​​Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer

TextBody:
Hello Tony,

I am glad that we were able to get your issue resolved. The following is a summary of the ticket for your records.

Symptom

We are ready to migrate from StealthAudit to Enterprise Auditor and would like assistance with the upgrade process. We will be migrating it from a 2012 server to a new 2022 server.

Cause

Migration request due to unsupported WinServer 2012

Resolution

Performed the migration process with the following steps:

• Obtain or save the installation media for SA.
• Backup the following files and folders from the StealthAUDIT folder (Typically found at "C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDIT"):
• ...STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITJobs: Contains the jobs from the SA jobs tree.
• ... STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITStealthAUDIT.LIC: The license key for the StealthAUDIT product • …STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITReports: This will ensure that you don’t have to go and republish all reports
• C:Program Files (x86)STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITFSAA: Contains short term data related to file server collections
• … STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITCLU: Contains any Command Line Utility parameters. • … STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITODBCProfilesCustom: Contains any custom ODBC connect strings for SQL.
• …STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITSADatabaseViews: Contains the host list definitions.
• ... STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITSecurityMap: Contains all of the connection profiles.
• ... STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITGlobalOptions.XML: Contains the Global Options.
• ... STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITSPProfiles.XML: Contains the Connection Profiles.
• ... STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITrba.conf: Contains the Role Based Access Configuration.
• …STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITrba-reporting.conf- Published Reports role-based access.
• …STEALTHbitsStealthAUDITWebwebserver.exe.config-Published Reports web server configuration.
• C:inetpubwwwrootStealthAUDIT Complianceweb.config – Access Information Center AIC web configuration.
• C:WindowsSystem32Tasks – Specifically tasks names beginning with “SAJOB*.job”

Following this email, you will receive an automated confirmation that the case is closed, along with the ability to re-open the case if any related errors return. In addition, you will also receive a separate email with a survey where you can let us know how we did. Feel free to leave any feedback via the survey link!

Thank you,

Scottie Taylor
Technical Support Engineer
____________________________
Cybersecurity That Works For You

6160 Warren Parkway, Suite 100, Frisco, TX 75034
www.netwrix.com
